Ensure student journalism survives PERIOD Donate today PERIOD

By  Nick SwedbergMarch  

The race to November for the Illinois seventieth Representative District seat is on and two candidates already have launched their campaigns PERIOD

On March  Robert Pritchard won the Republican nomination for state representative while Bob Brown took the Democratic nomination PERIOD Pritchard is the incumbent PERIOD

Currently Pritchard is in Springfield working to pass the state budget he said PERIOD His main focus is with the legislature and he said he will not switch his focus to campaigning until after the session adjourns for the summer PERIOD

Pritchard said he already has begun campaigning on campus and has been talking to the people involved with governmental affairs PERIOD He said NIU is a key focus for his campaign PERIOD

It has been and continues to be a part of my goals Pritchard said PERIOD

Brown also has started his run for November PERIOD

The second half of the campaign has just begun Brown said PERIOD

He said he has three parts to his campaign PERIOD He wants to hold town hall meetings where people can come and talk with him PERIOD

Brown said he also is going to craft a campaign platform by talking with local experts in the area about issues PERIOD He described the proposed conversations as no holds barred and wants to cover each issue carefully PERIOD

He said he then wants to meet with organizations in the area such as civics clubs and talk with them PERIOD Brown also wants to encourage young people and try to energize the NIU campus PERIOD

Brown will build his campaign over the next few months by talking to student organizations PERIOD He said he has been contacted by the Black Student Union and the College Democrats PERIOD

The Brown campaign started with no money and has started building contacts with donators Brown said PERIOD His campaign team is talking to local representatives of union groups such as the United Auto Workers and the Illinois Federation of Teachers PERIOD He said each group looks at the candidates and decides who they want to help out PERIOD
